trans-unit.source: Property "data" is mandatory.
Property "data" must be either "array" or "xml".
The chosen connector is not available or not defined.
The dataHandler does not implement \Cobweb\ExternalImport\DataHandlerInterface. Data will be left in its raw state.
The dataHandler class cannot be instantiated. Data will be left in its raw state.
The dataHandler class cannot be found. Data will be left in its raw state.
Property "nodetype" is mandatory for "xml"-type data.
Either property "nodetype" or "nodepath" must be set for "xml"-type data.
Property "referenceUid" is mandatory.
Property "priority" is not set. It will default to %d.
Property "pid" is not set. Records will be stored on root page.
Property "pid" is not set. Records would be stored on root page, but this is not allowed for table %s.
Property "pid" is not valid. It must be equal to or greater than zero.
Property "pid" is not valid. Records for table %s can only be stored on root page.
Property "useColumnIndex" is set to %1$s, but no matching configuration exists for table %2$s.
Property "additionalFields" still uses a comma-separated syntax. It should be moved to the new syntax (see documentation). Backwards-compatibility will be dropped in the future.
Additional fields configuration is now displayed alongside that of other fields in the "Columns mapping" tab.
Property "customSteps" contains an erroneous configuration. Invalid custom steps are ignored. Reported error is: %1$s (exception code: %2$d).
Property "field" is mandatory for "array"-type data.
Array-type data must have either a "field", "value" or a "arrayPath" property.
No configuration. The imported value will be that of the node directly targeted by the "nodetype" property.
You should normally not set both the "value" and the "field" properties as they are conflicting. The "value" property takes precedence.
You should normally not set both the "value" property and one of "field", "atribute" or "xpath", as they are conflicting. The "value" property takes precedence.
Property "%1$s" was renamed to "%2$s". Please update your configuration.
The following properties were renamed to lowerCamelCase names: %s. Please update your configuration.
Property "%1$s" should be placed inside the "transformations" property.
Properties "%1$s" should be placed inside the "transformations" property.
A backwards-compatibility layer currently updates your configuration automatically, but it will be removed in the next major version. Please update your configuration.
The "userFunc" transformations property has been renamed to "userFunction". Backwards-compatibility is ensured for now. Please update your configuration.
The "params" sub-property of the "userFunc" transformations property has been renamed to "parameters". Backwards-compatibility is ensured for now. Please update your configuration.

The "userFunc" transformations property has been renamed to "userFunction" and its "params" sub-property has been renamed to "parameters". Backwards-compatibility is ensured for now. Please update your configuration.
The "children" property must be an array.
The "children" property must have a "table" information.
The "children" property must have a "columns" information.
The "columns" information of the "children" property must be an array.
The "columns" information of the "children" property must use "field" or "value" as key, not "%s".
The "sorting" information of the "children" property must contain both a "source" and a "target" sub-property.

The "controlColumnsForUpdate" information of the "children" property is not set or is empty. This means that all child records will be considered to be new and be created unless the "insert" operation has been disabled.
The "controlColumnsForUpdate" information of the "children" property contains one or more reference to columns that are not defined in the "columns" information: %s
The "controlColumnsForDelete" information of the "children" property is not set or is empty. This means that existing child records will never be deleted.
The "controlColumnsForDelete" information of the "children" property contains one or more reference to columns that are not defined in the "columns" information: %s

The "controlColumnsForDelete" information of the "children" property is set but not the "controlColumnsForUpdate" property. This means that all child records will be deleted unless the "delete" operation has been disabled.
The "substructureFields" property for field %s must be an array.
The "substructureFields" configuration for field %s is empty. This is not allowed for array-type data.
The "substructureFields" configuration contains invalid properties (%1$s) for array-type data. Only %2$s are allowed.
The "substructureFields" configuration contains invalid properties (%1$s) for XML-type data. Only %2$s are allowed (as well as being empty).
The MM property is deprecated. Do not use it anymore. Switch to "multipleRows" or "children" instead.
